main event: A circular, reddish-orange object with a hazy glow was observed by ground radar and a supervisor at the Seattle ATCO (Air Traffic Control) facility in 1960.
interesting points: The object moved erratically for 3-4 minutes, then spread out and disappeared.
The object made a sudden change in direction with no apparent decrease in speed.
Four round objects were observed by the ATCO supervisor, moving in opposite directions at varying durations.
The objects moved in a straight course, with an apparent acceleration and steady speed.
No other unusual weather or aircraft were observed during the sighting.
sighted object: circular, reddish-orange object with a hazy glow
